what: Tools for Putative Annotation of Electrospray Ionisation High Resolution Mass Spectrometry Data
title: Tools for Putative Annotation of Electrospray Ionisation High Resolution Mass Spectrometry Data
text: Tools aid putative annotation accurate m/z high resolution electrospray ionisation mass spectrometry (ESI-MS) data.

title: Tools for Putative Annotation of Electrospray Ionisation High Resolution Mass Spectrometry Data

title: Tools for Putative Annotation of Electrospray Ionisation High Resolution Mass Spectrometry Data

what: The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
title: The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
text: Calculate proportion C, H O specified molecular formulas.

title: The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
text: element_frequencies tibble containing element frequencies returned elementFrequencies()

title: The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
text: tibble containing CHO proportions specified element frequencies.

title: The proportion of C, H and O atoms in molecular formulas — CHOproportion
code: c('H2O','C12H22O11') %>%    elementFrequencies() %>%    CHOproportion() #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   MF          CHO total_atoms `CHO proportion` #>   <chr>     <dbl>       <dbl>            <dbl> #> 1 C12H22O11    45          45                1 #> 2 H2O           3           3                1

title: Molecular formula adduct transformation — adductTransformMF
text: Transform molecular formula based specified adduct.

title: Molecular formula adduct transformation — adductTransformMF
text: MF molecular formula transform adduct transformation adduct adduct_rules_table adduct formation rules. Defaults adduct_rules().

title: Molecular formula adduct transformation — adductTransformMF
text: transformed molecular formula.

title: Adduct formation rules — adduct_rules
text: Formation rules electrospray ionisation adducts

title: Adduct formation rules — adduct_rules
text: tibble containing 58 rows 6 columns Name Adduct name Charge Charge added xM Number M needed Add Mass value change Nelec Electron change AddAt pseudo formula atoms added molecular formula one M RemAt pseudo formula atoms removed molecular formula one M AddEx pseudo formula atoms added final ionisation product molecular formula RemEx pseudo formula atoms removed final ionisation product molecular formula Rule Structural rule formation

Calculate a molecular formula  accurate mass — calcAccurateMass

what: Calculate the molecular mass of an m/z — calcM
title: Calculate the molecular mass of an m/z — calcM
text: Calculate molecular mass given mass charge ratio, adduct, isotope transformation.

title: Calculate the molecular mass of an m/z — calcM
code: calcM(   mz,   adduct = "[M+H]1+",   isotope = NA,   transformation = NA,   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   isotope_rules_table = isotope_rules(),   transformation_rules_table = transformation_rules() )

title: Calculate the molecular mass of an m/z — calcM
text: mz mass charge ratio adduct adduct apply isotope isotope apply transformation transformation apply adduct_rules_table tibble containing available adduct formation rules. Defaults adduct_rules(). isotope_rules_table tibble containing available isotopic rules. Defaults isotope_rules(). transformation_rules_table tibble containing available transformation rules. Defaults transformation_rules().

title: Calculate the molecular mass of an m/z — calcM

what: Calculate the m/z of a mass — calcMZ
title: Calculate the m/z of a mass — calcMZ
text: Calculate mass charge ratio given molecular mass, adduct, isotope transformation.

title: Calculate the m/z of a mass — calcMZ
code: calcMZ(   M,   adduct = "[M+H]1+",   isotope = NA,   transformation = NA,   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   isotope_rules_table = isotope_rules(),   transformation_rules_table = transformation_rules() )

title: Calculate the m/z of a mass — calcMZ
text: M molecular mass adduct adduct apply isotope isotope apply transformation transformation apply adduct_rules_table adduct table containing available adduct rules. Defaults adducts(). isotope_rules_table isotope table containing available isotope rules. Defaults isotopes(). transformation_rules_table transformations table containing available transformations rules. Defaults transformations().

title: Calculate the m/z of a mass — calcMZ
Element count checks — elementCountCheck
text: Element count checks based Rule 6 Seven Golden Rules Kind et al 2007.

title: Element count checks — elementCountCheck
text: element_frequencies tibble containing element frequencies returned elementFrequencies()

title: Element count checks — elementCountCheck
text: tibble containing results element count checks. column headers specify check criteria. TRUE returned relevant checks passed FALSE . NA returned check relevant.

title: Element count checks — elementCountCheck
text: Kind, T. Fiehn, O., 2007. Seven Golden Rules heuristic filtering molecular formulas obtained accurate mass spectrometry. BMC bioinformatics, 8(1), pp.1-20.

title: Element count checks — elementCountCheck
code: elementFrequencies(c('H2O','C12H22O11')) %>%    elementCountCheck() #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   MF        NOP all >= 3; N < 11, O < 22, P < …¹ NOPS …² NOS a…³ OPS a…⁴ PSN a…⁵ #>   <chr>     <lgl>                                <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #> 1 H2O       NA                                   NA      NA      NA      NA      #> 2 C12H22O11 NA                                   NA      NA      NA      NA      #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​`NOP all >= 3; N < 11, O < 22, P < 6`, #> #   ²​`NOPS all >= 1; N < 10, O < 20, P < 4, S < 3`, #> #   ³​`NOS all >= 6; N < 19, O < 14, S < 8`, #> #   ⁴​`OPS all >= 1; O < 14, P < 3, S < 3`, ⁵​`PSN all >= 1; P < 3, S < 3, N < 4`

title: Extract element frequencies — elementFrequencies
code: elementFrequencies(c('H2O','C12H22O11')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   MF            H     O     C #>   <chr>     <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 H2O           2     1    NA #> 2 C12H22O11    22    11    12

title: Element ratio checks — elementRatioCheck
text: Element ratio checks based Rules 4 5 Seven Golden Rules Kind et al 2007.

title: Element ratio checks — elementRatioCheck
text: element_ratios tibble containing molecular formula elemental ratios range ratio threshold ranges defined Rules 4 5 Seven Golden Rules Kind et al 2007

title: Element ratio checks — elementRatioCheck
text: tibble containing results element ratio checks. column headers specify check criteria. TRUE returned relevant checks passed FALSE . NA returned check relevant.

title: Element ratio checks — elementRatioCheck
text: Kind, T. Fiehn, O., 2007. Seven Golden Rules heuristic filtering molecular formulas obtained accurate mass spectrometry. BMC bioinformatics, 8(1), pp.1-20.

title: Element ratio checks — elementRatioCheck
code: ## Using the 'common' ratio ranges c('H2O','C12H22O11') %>%    elementFrequencies() %>%    elementRatios() %>%    elementRatioCheck(range = 'common') #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   MF        `H/C > 0.2` `H/C < 3.1` `N/C < 1.3` `O/C < 1.2` `P/C < 0.3` S/C < …¹ #>   <chr>     <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>    #> 1 H2O       NA          NA          NA          NA          NA          NA       #> 2 C12H22O11 TRUE        TRUE        NA          TRUE        NA          NA       #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​`S/C < 0.8`  ## Using the 'extreme' ratio ranges c('H2O','C12H22O11') %>%    elementFrequencies() %>%    elementRatios() %>%    elementRatioCheck(range = 'extreme') #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   MF        `H/C < 0.1` `H/C > 6` `N/C > 1.3` `O/C > 1.2` `P/C > 0.3` S/C > 0.…¹ #>   <chr>     <lgl>       <lgl>     <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>       <lgl>      #> 1 H2O       NA          NA        NA          NA          NA          NA         #> 2 C12H22O11 FALSE       FALSE     NA          FALSE       NA          NA         #> # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​`S/C > 0.8`

title: Calculate element ratios — elementRatios
text: Calculate ratios element frequency combinations.

title: Calculate element ratios — elementRatios
text: element_frequencies tibble containing element frequencies returned elementFrequencies() elements character vector elements calculate ratios

title: Calculate element ratios — elementRatios
text: tibble containing element frequency ratios element combinations. NA returned element ratios relevant given molecular formula.

title: Calculate element ratios — elementRatios
code: elementFrequencies(c('H2O','C12H22O11')) %>%    elementRatios() #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   MF         `C/H` `C/O` `H/C` `H/O`  `O/C` `O/H` #>   <chr>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 H2O       NA     NA    NA        2 NA       0.5 #> 2 C12H22O11  0.545  1.09  1.83     2  0.917   0.5

text: mass molecular mass ppm parts per million error tolerance charge total charge element_ranges named list element ranges

text: tibble containing generated molecular formulas, theoretical mass PPM error.

what: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
title: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
text: Heuristic tests molecular formulas based Golden Rules 2, 4, 5 6 Kind et al 2007.

title: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
text: MF vector molecular formulas

title: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
text: tibble containing golden rule heuristic check results. TRUE returned relevant Golden Rule satisfied FALSE . NA returned rule relevant molecular formula.

title: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
text: Kind, T. Fiehn, O., 2007. Seven Golden Rules heuristic filtering molecular formulas obtained accurate mass spectrometry. BMC bioinformatics, 8(1), pp.1-20.

title: Golden rule tests for molecular formulas — goldenRules
code: goldenRules(c('H2O','C12H22O11')) #> # A tibble: 2 × 15 #>   MF        LEWIS SENIOR H/C >…¹ H/C <…² N/C <…³ O/C <…⁴ P/C <…⁵ S/C <…⁶ NOP a…⁷ #>   <chr>     <lgl> <lgl>  <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   <lgl>   #> 1 H2O       TRUE  FALSE  NA      NA      NA      NA      NA      NA      NA      #> 2 C12H22O11 TRUE  TRUE   TRUE    TRUE    NA      TRUE    NA      NA      NA      #> # … with 5 more variables: `NOPS all >= 1; N < 10, O < 20, P < 4, S < 3` <lgl>, #> #   `NOS all >= 6; N < 19, O < 14, S < 8` <lgl>, #> #   `OPS all >= 1; O < 14, P < 3, S < 3` <lgl>, #> #   `PSN all >= 1; P < 3, S < 3, N < 4` <lgl>, `CHO proportion` <dbl>, and #> #   abbreviated variable names ¹​`H/C > 0.2`, ²​`H/C < 3.1`, ³​`N/C < 1.3`, #> #   ⁴​`O/C < 1.2`, ⁵​`P/C < 0.3`, ⁶​`S/C < 0.8`, #> #   ⁷​`NOP all >= 3; N < 11, O < 22, P < 6`

title: Molecular formula plausibility scores — goldenRulesScore
text: Percentage scores molecular formula plausibility based Rules 2, 4, 5 6 Kind et al 2007.

title: Molecular formula plausibility scores — goldenRulesScore
text: golden_rules tibble containing golden rule heuristic checks results goldenRules()

title: Molecular formula plausibility scores — goldenRulesScore
text: tibble containing golden rules plausibility percentage scores.

title: Molecular formula plausibility scores — goldenRulesScore
text: Kind, T. Fiehn, O., 2007. Seven Golden Rules heuristic filtering molecular formulas obtained accurate mass spectrometry. BMC bioinformatics, 8(1), pp.1-20.

title: Molecular formula plausibility scores — goldenRulesScore
code: c('H2O','C12H22O11') %>%    goldenRules() %>%    goldenRulesScore() #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   MF        `LEWIS and SENIOR` `Element ratios` `Element counts` CHO p…¹ Plaus…² #>   <chr>                  <dbl>            <dbl>            <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 C12H22O11                1                  1                1       1   100   #> 2 H2O                      0.5                1                1       1    87.5 #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​`CHO proportion`, ²​`Plausibility (%)`

what: Ionisation product molecular formula generation — ipMF

title: Ionisation product molecular formula generation — ipMF
text: mz accurate m/z adduct ionisation product adduct isotope ionisation product isotope ppm parts per million error tolerance threshold adduct_rules_table tibble containing available adduct formation rules. Defaults adduct_rules(). isotope_rules_table tibble containing available isotopic rules. Defaults isotope_rules().

title: Ionisation product molecular formula generation — ipMF
code: ipMF(118.08626,adduct = '[M+H]1+') #> # A tibble: 2 × 9 #>   MF        Adduct  Isotope Measured m…¹ Measu…² Theor…³ Theor…⁴ PPM e…⁵ Plaus…⁶ #>   <chr>     <chr>   <lgl>          <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 C5H11NO2  [M+H]1+ NA              118.    117.    118.    117.    0       98.7 #> 2 CH14N2O2P [M+H]1+ NA              118.    117.    118.    117.    2.63    54.6 #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​`Measured m/z`, ²​`Measured M`, #> #   ³​`Theoretical m/z`, ⁴​`Theoretical M`, ⁵​`PPM error`, ⁶​`Plausibility (%)`

title: Transformation rules — transformation_rules
code: transformation_names() #>  [1] "M - [O] + [NH2]"   "M - [OH] + [NH2]"  "M + [H2]"          #>  [4] "M - [H2] + [O]"    "M - [H] + [CH3]"   "M - [H] + [NH2]"   #>  [7] "M - [H] + [OH]"    "M + [H2O]"         "M - [H3] + [H2O]"  #> [10] "M - [H] + [CHO2]"  "M - [H] + [SO3]"   "M - [H] + [PO3H2]"  transformation_rules() #> # A tibble: 12 × 10 #>    Name              MF Ch…¹ Diffe…²     C     H     N     O     P     S Default #>    <chr>             <chr>     <dbl> <int> <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>   <int> #>  1 Transamination 1  M - [O…  0.0238     0     2     1    -1     0     0       1 #>  2 Ammonia ligation  M - [O… -0.984      0     1     1    -1     0     0       1 #>  3 Hydrogenation     M + [H…  2.02       0     2     0     0     0     0       1 #>  4 Alcohol to carbo… M - [H… 14.0        0    -2     0     1     0     0       1 #>  5 Methylation       M - [H… 14.0        1     2     0     0     0     0       1 #>  6 Transamination 2  M - [H… 15.0        0     1     1     0     0     0       1 #>  7 Hydroxylation     M - [H… 16.0        0     0     0     1     0     0       1 #>  8 Hydration         M + [H… 18.0        0     2     0     1     0     0       1 #>  9 Methyl to carbox… M - [H… 30.0        0    -1     0     1     0     0       1 #> 10 Carboxylation     M - [H… 44.0        1     0     0     2     0     0       1 #> 11 Sulphation        M - [H… 80.0        0    -1     0     3     0     1       1 #> 12 Phosphorylation   M - [H… 80.0        0     1     0     3     1     0       1 #> # … with abbreviated variable names ¹​`MF Change`, ²​Difference

title: mzAnnotation 2.0.0
text: chemical structure (SMILES, InChI) chemoinformatics functionality based OpenBabel now moved cheminf package. adduct, isotope transformation rules functions adduct(), isotope() transformations() renamed adduct_rules(), isotope_rules() transformation_rules() respectively. Added adduct_names(), isotope_names() transformation_names() functions list available adducts, isotopes transformations default rules tables. Added suitableElementRanges() calculate minimum maximum elemental ranges specified molecular mass, suitable molecular formula generation. Added elementRatios() calculating ratio elements present specified molecular formulas. Added CHOproportion() calculating proportion CHO present specified molecular formulas. Added functions calculating rings plus double bonds equivalent (rdbe()), LEWIS valence test lewis() senior() molecular graph test molecular formulas. Added functions (goldenRules(),elementCountCheck(),elementRatioCheck()) calculating Golden Rules 2, 3, 5 6 Kind et al. 2007. Added ipMF() generating molecular formulas electrospray ionisation products. Added transformationPossible() test transformation two molecular formulas possible. count.elements() now re-exported CHNOSZ package. digits option now set 7 package load. specified adduct, isotope transformation arguments now checked specified adduct_rules_table, isotope_rules_table transformation_rules_table calcM() calcMZ(). error thrown present. Numerous function documentation improvements.

title: mzAnnotation 1.7.5
text: Fixed error relationshipCalculator() empty returns.

title: mzAnnotation 1.7.4
text: Remove modes argument form relationshipCalcualtor(). Speed uprelationshipCalculator() ~x20.

title: mzAnnotation 1.7.3
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added pkgdown site available https://jasenfinch.github.io/mzAnnotation/.
